results.title: Teaching game activities to intermediate children (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: George Longstaff and Burbank Audio Visual
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Game Activities”
Illustrates how individual, partner and group activities may be used to teach games such as soccer, basketball and softball. Numerous examples are provided to show how to effectively use the problem solving method and the inventive games approach to upper elementary school children.

results.title: Field events
results.creator_credit: Jan Ladlo and Associated Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Fundamentals of the Track and Field for Girls”.
This film designed as a teaching tool, emphasizes form and techniques. The field events such as long jump; standing broad jump; high jump; discus; shot put; and javelin are explained.

results.title: Four Corners: The Moonlight State
results.creator_credit: Shaun Hoyt and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Despite denials by the Minister for Local Government Russ Hinze, Police Commissioner Terence Lewis, and Police Minister, Bill Gunn, widespread police corruption is evident throughout Queensland. Brothels masquerading as massage parlours with illegal gambling inhouse and drug trafficking are shown. Persons prominent in the criminal activities are named. This program was a major contributor to the setting up of the Fitzgerald Enquiry into Corruption in Queensland. Presenter: Andrew Olle. Reporter: Chris Masters.
Episode of the ABC TV program Four Corners, aired 11/5/1987.

results.title: The Business of change
results.creator_credit: Francoise Fombertaux and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Four corners (Television program)”.
Change, particularly technological change, has become an unavoidable facet of daily life. In this changing world of work, to accept change has become a business - “being motivated to be motivated”. Teaching “change” is the new profession and trained psychologists are now moving into the area of business coaching - they are the highly skilled agents of change. Manufacturing and agricultural industries have decreased and have been replaced by the service industry which currently employs over 70% of the entire workforce in Australia. Professional people who have more money than time are increasingly outsourcing services, eg house maintenance and cleaning, pet care (professional dog walkers). Corporate, big business, and government agencies use Call Centres to centralise their customer service facilities. This program discusses motivational coaching as a means of helping people deal with change. Reference is also made to Frederick W. Taylor’s theory on organisational change, or Taylorism. Reporter: Tony Barrell.

results.title: Surviving survival
results.creator_credit: Morag Ramsay and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Four corners (Television program)”.
Today one in three people will come down with cancer before the age of 74 - 60% will survive. But it is the survivors who have to face life after cancer. Their victory over cancer is just the beginning of a long journey, where the survivor feels lost once treatment has ceased, that their life has changed and that they will always carry the fear of recurrence. Their psychological state of mind also impacts on the carers, often destroying close and longstanding relationships. This program examines the psychological after-effects for such patients and provides hope for the future for cancer survivors in the area of counselling and support. Contains some scenes in b&w. Reporter: Wendy Page.

results.title: Computers
results.creator_credit: David Stiven, Sam Lipski and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Four corners (Television program)”.
Discusses the devleopment and increasing use of computers in Australia. Banks, the TAB, the stock exchange, aviation companies and many government social service departments are extensively computerised. Computers have an invaluable application in medical research and hospital services, and road traffic control. Presents the problem of redundant workers in a computerised community and questions the morality of a National Data Bank.

results.title: Apollo 1
results.creator_credit: David Frankel, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Clavius Base
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
January 27, 1967. In preparation for the flight of Apollo 1, astronauts Gus Grissom, Ed White and Roger Chaffe undergo a routine test in their space capsule. The test turns into a disaster when a small electrical fire becomes a raging inferno - the lives of three men lost before they even leave the ground. The nation mourns, but the ever-watchful Senate Committee - anxious over the extreme haste and massive expenditure involved in the project thus far - may pull the plug on the entire Apollo project.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Frankel, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Clavius Base
results.description:
Episode number 2 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
January 27, 1967. In preparation for the flight of Apollo 1, astronauts Gus Grissom, Ed White and Roger Chaffe undergo a routine test in their space capsule. The test turns into a disaster when a small electrical fire becomes a raging inferno - the lives of three men lost before they even leave the ground. The nation mourns, but the ever-watchful Senate Committee - anxious over the extreme haste and massive expenditure involved in the project thus far - may pull the plug on the entire Apollo project.
description_for_label:
Episode number 2 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
January 27, 1967. In preparation for the flight of Apollo 1, astronauts Gus Grissom, Ed White and Roger Chaffe undergo a routine test in their space capsule. The test turns into a disaster when a small electrical fire becomes a raging inferno - the lives of three men lost before they even leave the ground. The nation mourns, but the ever-watchful Senate Committee - anxious over the extreme haste and massive expenditure involved in the project thus far - may pull the plug on the entire Apollo project.

results.title: New settlers of the inland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Four corners (Television program)”.
This program looks at the people who are forming alternative settlements in the Rainbow Region of Ne South Wales. Examines their motivation for leaving the city and shows the lifestyle they are now pursuing.
